—

What is Darius McCrary’s Net Worth?

Darius McCrary, an American actor and singer, has an estimated net worth of $10 thousand. McCrary gained fame through his role as Eddie Winslow in the television sitcom “Family Matters,” which aired from 1989 to 1998 and ran for nine seasons with 215 episodes. Additionally, he appeared on the soap opera “The Young and the Restless” as Malcolm Winters.

—

Highlights

– Darius McCrary’s net worth is $10 thousand.

– He gained fame through his role as Eddie Winslow on “Family Matters.”

– McCrary has experienced severe financial problems over the years.

– In 2019, he claimed to have only made $500 in the previous year.

– He was arrested in 2023 for failure to pay child support.

—

Early Life

Darius McCrary was born on May 1, 1976, in Walnut, California. His father, Howard McCrary, is a composer, singer, and music director who encouraged McCrary to get involved in the entertainment industry from a young age. McCrary also has a younger brother named Donovan.

—

Career

McCrary started his career at the age of 11, making his film debut in the 1987 film “Big Shots.” He went on to book various television show roles and appeared in films such as “Mississippi Burning” (1988). In 1989, McCrary landed his breakthrough role as Eddie Winslow in the television show “Family Matters” and received three Young Artist Award nominations during the show’s run.

After the end of “Family Matters,” McCrary continued to book television and film roles. He appeared in shows like “Freedom” (2000), “Kingpin” (2003), and films including “Kingdom Come,” “Kingdom Come,” and “15 Minutes.” He also ventured into music and released his first album after leaving “The Young and the Restless” in 2011.

Throughout his career, McCrary appeared in various television shows and films, such as “Committed,” “Transformers,” “Next Day Air,” and “Saw IV.” He also participated in theater productions like “The Maintenance Man.” In recent years, he joined the cast of the show “Monogamy” (2018) and appeared in films like “True to the Game 2” (2020) and “True to the Game 3” (2021), reprising his role.

—

Personal Life

McCrary has been married multiple times. He married Juliette Vann in 2005, but they divorced in 2006. In 2009, he married Karrine Steffans, an author, but they also divorced in 2011. In 2014, McCrary married Tammy Brawner, with whom he has a daughter named Zoey. However, they divorced in 2017.

Apart from his acting and singing career, McCrary is the founder of the FathersCare organization, a non-profit dedicated to empowering fathers and improving their relationships with their children. The organization operates under the McCrary Foundation, which was established by McCrary’s aunts and uncles, who were members of the gospel and R&B group, The McCrarys.

—

Net Worth Over Time

McCrary’s net worth has fluctuated over time. As of now, his estimated net worth is $10 thousand. However, he has faced severe financial problems, including owing $90,000 to the IRS in 2017 and being nearly broke. In 2023, he was arrested for failure to pay child support, with reports stating that he owed $53,000 at the time of his arrest.

—

Components of Net Worth

McCrary’s net worth is influenced by various factors, including his earnings from acting and singing projects, endorsements, investments, and personal expenses. While his role on “Family Matters” and other television shows and films contributed to his income, financial challenges and limited earning opportunities in recent years have affected his net worth. McCrary’s ongoing financial issues and legal obligations, such as child support payments, also impact his overall net worth.

—

In conclusion, Darius McCrary, the American actor and singer, currently has a net worth of $10 thousand. Despite gaining fame through his role on “Family Matters” and his appearances on other television shows and films, McCrary has faced significant financial challenges. His net worth has been impacted by factors such as limited earning opportunities, financial problems, and legal obligations. However, he continues to pursue his acting and singing career while also being involved in philanthropic efforts through the FathersCare organization.
